definition: convenient/handy/easy/bento (a meal in a partitioned box)/lunchbox
plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
(slang) (of a character) to reappear in a story line after having been supposedly killed off/cf. 領盒飯|领盒饭[ling3 he2 fan4]
to act unappreciatively in response to a kindness
pinyin: ba3 fang1 bian4 dang4 sui2 bian4

definition: see 領盒飯|领盒饭[ling3 he2 fan4]

sentences.english: You can use your favorite spices when preparing your bentos.
sentences.chinese: 当你在做便当的时候，你可以用上你最喜欢的香料。

sentences.english: Or often before you go to sleep in quiet often prone to tinnitus.
sentences.chinese: 在沉默时或临睡前常便当产生耳鸣，看看神经衰弱药。

sentences.english: Think of it as a waste-not, want-not kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 把便当视为一个不浪费，不匮乏的小厨房。

sentences.english: The Japanese-style bento lunch box featured U.S. pork and other dishes from both countries.
sentences.chinese: 日式便当盒饭包括美国的猪肉和两国的其他菜肴。

sentences.english: The forehead thermometer is much easier to use.
sentences.chinese: 这个前额测温的体温计愈加便当运用。

sentences.english: Prep the pantry with liquids, tea and chicken soup.
sentences.chinese: 同时准备一些流质食物，便当和鸡汤。

sentences.english: Give bentos – and your health – a chance.
sentences.chinese: 给你的便当，同时也给你的健康一个机会。

sentences.english: At seventeen he had been a district organizer of the Junior Anti-Sex League.
sentences.chinese: 到十七岁，他便当上了反性青年团的区队长。

sentences.english: I made lovely bento for Hiro and took them to his shop.
sentences.chinese: 我为宏做可爱的便当，并给他送到店里。

sentences.english: You’re already forgoing restaurant takeout and brown-bagging it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想放弃从餐厅带外卖或带便当。

sentences.english: Because his inconvenience when, that the flag to temporarily stayed curtilage yue home.
sentences.chinese: 因旗本家当晚不便当，只好暂时下榻宅悦家中。

sentences.english: Remember when your mom or dad used to pack your lunch?
sentences.chinese: 记得曾几何时，爸爸妈妈帮你准备午餐便当的情景吗？

sentences.english: But more sharp contrast makes the users eye detection easier.
sentences.chinese: 而更迟顿的差比使得搁置者用眼检测更为便当。

sentences.english: One week bring a sack-lunch, one week eat out.
sentences.chinese: 一周带便当，一个星期在外面吃。

sentences.english: Fencihu lunch, have at least seven dishes inside.
sentences.chinese: 奋起湖便当，里头至少都有七样菜。

definition: to arrange/to handle/to cook/cuisine/art of cooking
rice ball (steamed rice formed into a ball and stuffed with various fillings)/onigiri (Japanese-style rice ball)
oden, Japanese dish made with boiled eggs, processed fish cakes, daikon radish, tofu etc in a kelp-based broth
plain cooked rice/rice with nothing to go with it
